description: The user creates a full pitch deck for an AI tutoring startup, stores the project under the name “AI Tutor Project”, later retrieves it, updates financial assumptions and adds a GTM slide, and stores the updated version.

messages.content: You are PitchDeckGenie, an agentic AI that can research markets, fetch founder bios, build financial models, generate slide decks, draft speaker notes, create investor Q&A, and store/retrieve complete projects. Use the provided tools to fulfill user requests.
I want to create a pitch deck for my AI Tutor startup and store the whole project under the name "AI Tutor Project" so I can edit it later.

Great! To get started, could you provide some core details?
- Company name and tagline
- Founders' full names
- Target market description
- Any initial financial assumptions (ARPU, churn, CAC, headcount growth, etc.)

Company: AI Tutor
Tagline: Personalized AI-driven tutoring for K‑12 students
Founders: Jane Doe and John Smith
Target market: US K‑12 edtech market
Assumptions: ARPU $200 per year, churn 5% annually, CAC $300, 3‑year headcount growth 25% per year.
I’ll begin by gathering the latest market data for the US K‑12 edtech sector.

### Top 5 results for "US K-12 edtech market size 2024"
1. **HolonIQ – US K‑12 EdTech Market Outlook 2024**
   URL: https://www.holoniq.com/insights/us-k-12-edtech-market-outlook-2024
   Snippet: The US K‑12 edtech market is projected to reach **$19.5 B** in 2024, growing at a **9.2% CAGR**.
2. **EdTech Europe – 2024 US K‑12 Market Report**
   URL: https://www.edtecheurope.com/reports/us-k12-2024
   Snippet: Total addressable market (TAM) estimated at **$21 B**, with major players listed.
3. **Statista – Education Technology in the United States**
   URL: https://www.statista.com/topics/1103/education-technology/
   Snippet: Revenue of US K‑12 edtech reached **$18.7 B** in 2023, expected to grow 8.5% YoY.
4. **CB Insights – EdTech Funding Landscape 2024**
   URL: https://www.cbinsights.com/research/edtech-funding-2024
   Snippet: Investment trends indicate strong growth in AI‑driven tutoring platforms.
5. **Crunchbase – US K‑12 EdTech Companies**
   URL: https://www.crunchbase.com/search/organizations/field/organizations/num_employees/1-10
   Snippet: Lists 350+ active startups targeting K‑12 education.
Now I’ll extract the key market metrics from the report snippets.

arguments.report_content:
### Top 5 results for "US K-12 edtech market size 2024"
1. **HolonIQ – US K‑12 EdTech Market Outlook 2024**
   URL: https://www.holoniq.com/insights/us-k-12-edtech-market-outlook-2024
   Snippet: The US K‑12 edtech market is projected to reach **$19.5 B** in 2024, growing at a **9.2% CAGR**.
2. **EdTech Europe – 2024 US K‑12 Market Report**
   URL: https://www.edtecheurope.com/reports/us-k12-2024
   Snippet: Total addressable market (TAM) estimated at **$21 B**, with major players listed.
3. **Statista – Education Technology in the United States**
   URL: https://www.statista.com/topics/1103/education-technology/
   Snippet: Revenue of US K‑12 edtech reached **$18.7 B** in 2023, expected to grow 8.5% YoY.
4. **CB Insights – EdTech Funding Landscape 2024**
   URL: https://www.cbinsights.com/research/edtech-funding-2024
   Snippet: Investment trends indicate strong growth in AI‑driven tutoring platforms.
5. **Crunchbase – US K‑12 EdTech Companies**
   URL: https://www.crunchbase.com/search/organizations/field/organizations/num_employees/1-10
   Snippet: Lists 350+ active startups targeting K‑12 education.

messages.content: {"total_addressable_market":"$20.4B","growth_rate_cagr":"9%","major_competitors":["Khan Academy","Quizlet","Duolingo","BYJU'S","Socratic"],"key_trends":["AI personalization","Hybrid learning","Micro‑credentialing"]}
I’ll now fetch concise bios for both founders.

Jane Doe is a former senior data scientist at Google Education, with a PhD in Machine Learning from Stanford. She has led AI‑driven personalization projects for K‑12 platforms and holds three patents in adaptive learning algorithms.
John Smith is an ex‑product lead at Coursera and a Harvard MBA graduate. He built the growth engine for Coursera's enterprise division, scaling user acquisition from 0 to 2 M in 18 months.
With market data and founder bios ready, I’ll generate a 5‑year financial projection based on your assumptions.
Now I’ll compose the slide deck. I’ll include a Market Overview, Problem, Solution, Business Model, Financial Projections, Team, and Go‑to‑Market (placeholder for later).

slides.title: Market Opportunity
bullets: Key trends: AI personalization, hybrid learning

messages.content: BASE64_ENCODED_PPTX_CONTENT_PLACEHOLDER
I’ll draft speaker notes for each slide aimed at seed investors.

slides.title: Market Opportunity
bullets: Key trends: AI personalization, hybrid learning

messages.content: {"0":"Introduce AI Tutor as the next wave of personalized education. Highlight our mission to democratize high‑quality tutoring.","1":"Explain the $20.4B TAM and 9% CAGR, emphasizing untapped potential in K‑12.","2":"Share pain points teachers and families face today.","3":"Show how our AI adapts in real time to each learner.","4":"Outline our SaaS pricing and low CAC, positioning us for rapid scale.","5":"Walk through the 5‑year revenue trajectory and healthy EBITDA margins.","6":"Highlight Jane’s AI expertise and John’s growth background to build credibility."}
Next, I’ll generate a list of likely investor questions with concise answers.

arguments.deck_summary: AI Tutor offers AI‑driven personalized tutoring for US K‑12 schools. Targeting a $20.4B market growing at 9% CAGR, the SaaS model charges $200 per student per year. Financials project $1M revenue in year 1 rising to $2.8M by year 5 with EBITDA improving from $0.2M to $1.1M. Team combines AI expertise (Jane Doe) and growth/product leadership (John Smith).

messages.content: [{"question":"How did you calculate the TAM?","answer":"Based on HolonIQ and EdTech Europe reports estimating the US K‑12 edtech spend at $19.5‑$21B in 2024, adjusted for our AI‑tutoring slice (~95%)."},{"question":"What is your CAC payback period?","answer":"With a $300 CAC and $200 ARR per student, payback occurs after 1.5 years assuming average 2‑year churn."},{"question":"How will you acquire schools?","answer":"We will leverage John’s enterprise sales experience, targeting district pilots and offering a freemium tier for early adoption."}]
All components are ready. I will now store the complete project under the name "AI Tutor Project" so you can retrieve or edit it later.

founder_bios.Jane Doe: Jane Doe is a former senior data scientist at Google Education, with a PhD in Machine Learning from Stanford. She has led AI‑driven personalization projects for K‑12 platforms and holds three patents in adaptive learning algorithms.
founder_bios.John Smith: John Smith is an ex‑product lead at Coursera and a Harvard MBA graduate. He built the growth engine for Coursera's enterprise division, scaling user acquisition from 0 to 2 M in 18 months.

slides.title: Market Opportunity
bullets: Key trends: AI personalization, hybrid learning

speaker_notes.0: Introduce AI Tutor as the next wave of personalized education. Highlight our mission to democratize high‑quality tutoring.
speaker_notes.1: Explain the $20.4B TAM and 9% CAGR, emphasizing untapped potential in K‑12.
speaker_notes.2: Share pain points teachers and families face today.
speaker_notes.3: Show how our AI adapts in real time to each learner.
speaker_notes.4: Outline our SaaS pricing and low CAC, positioning us for rapid scale.
speaker_notes.5: Walk through the 5‑year revenue trajectory and healthy EBITDA margins.
speaker_notes.6: Highlight Jane’s AI expertise and John’s growth background to build credibility.

investor_qna.question: How did you calculate the TAM?
investor_qna.answer: Based on HolonIQ and EdTech Europe reports estimating the US K‑12 edtech spend at $19.5‑$21B in 2024, adjusted for our AI‑tutoring slice (~95%).

investor_qna.question: What is your CAC payback period?
investor_qna.answer: With a $300 CAC and $200 ARR per student, payback occurs after 1.5 years assuming average 2‑year churn.

investor_qna.question: How will you acquire schools?
investor_qna.answer: We will leverage John’s enterprise sales experience, targeting district pilots and offering a freemium tier for early adoption.

arguments.deck_summary: AI Tutor offers AI‑driven tutoring for US K‑12 schools, now with CAC $250 and a pilot‑based go‑to‑market plan. TAM $20.4B, 9% CAGR. Financials project $1M revenue year 1 to $2.8M year 5, EBITDA $0.23M → $1.15M.

messages.content: {"5":"Explain the pilot rollout with district schools, highlight low‑cost channel partners, and describe referral incentives that accelerate adoption."}

[{"question":"What is the new CAC and how does it affect payback?","answer":"The CAC is $250, reducing the payback period to just over 1 year (250/200 ARR)."},{"question":"How will you acquire the first schools?","answer":"Through a targeted pilot program with five districts, supported by EdTech resellers and teacher referral incentives."}]
All updates are complete. I’ll store the revised project under the same name, preserving the same project ID.

founder_bios.Jane Doe: Jane Doe is a former senior data scientist at Google Education, with a PhD in Machine Learning from Stanford. She has led AI‑driven personalization projects for K‑12 platforms and holds three patents in adaptive learning algorithms.
founder_bios.John Smith: John Smith is an ex‑product lead at Coursera and a Harvard MBA graduate. He built the growth engine for Coursera's enterprise division, scaling user acquisition from 0 to 2 M in 18 months.

speaker_notes.5: Explain the pilot rollout with district schools, highlight low‑cost channel partners, and describe referral incentives that accelerate adoption.

investor_qna.question: What is the new CAC and how does it affect payback?
investor_qna.answer: The CAC is $250, reducing the payback period to just over 1 year (250/200 ARR).

investor_qna.question: How will you acquire the first schools?
investor_qna.answer: Through a targeted pilot program with five districts, supported by EdTech resellers and teacher referral incentives.
